Copyright (c) 2006-2009 Philip R. Zimmermann. All rights reserved.
        Contact: http://philzimmermann.com 

	Zfone is a software product that lets you turn your existing VoIP client into a secure phone.
Zfone runs in the Internet Protocol stack on any Windows XP, Mac OS X, or Linux PC, and intercepts
and filters all the VoIP packets as they go in and out of the machine, and secures the call on the fly. 
You can use a variety of different software VoIP clients to make a VoIP call with Zfone. Tested VOIP 
clients include Gizmo, iChat, SJPhone, Ekiga, Xmeeting and others. This Zfone changelog.html file 
began with the release on 11 Sept 2007.  These release notes were authored by Viktor Krikun.

09  Feb 2009  (Linux 0.9.245), (MacOS 0.9.263), (Win 0.9.217)
====================================================================================

This build includes improvements in ZRTP secure protocol and supports the latest version of libzrtp.0.80.
Enhanced ZRTP protocol to comply with the recommendations from NIST SP800-108, which will make it easier
to get FIPS-140 validation for ZRTP products.

14  Nov 2008  (Linux 0.9.231), (MacOS 0.9.254), (Win 0.9.212)
====================================================================================

This build includes no significant improvements in VoIP call detection capabilities. It just reflects changes in
ZRTP protocol and supports the latest version of libzrtp.

What's new in ZRTP:
	• Changes in libzrtp sources tree;
	• Improvements in libzrtp initialization routine;
	• Improvements in support for passive mode;
	• Improvements in ZRTP feedback interface and system-dependent functions;
	• ZRTP configuration approach was improved;
	• Implemented new functions in protocol according to the Internet Draft v 10.
	• and other changes, the details of which may be found in libzrtp.

	More details about these changes can be found in libzrtp.

03  Sep 2008  (Linux 0.9.224), (MacOS 0.9.246), (Win 0.9.206)
====================================================================================

What's new in ZRTP:

  1. Fixed bug with incorrect maximum value for T1 retry interval timer which increased delay between
LOOKING_FOR_ZRTP and NO_ZRTP_SUPPORT states.
  2. Implemented version negotiation according to the latest specification. libzrtp v 0.6.8 supports ZRTP
v0.90 only.
  3. New libzrtp licensing scheme was implemented. It allows the licensing policy to be changed at run time.
See zrtp_license_mode_t doc. for more details. Affected API - zrtp_init(). ZFone runs on ACTIVE license
mode and be able to establish SECURE calls with ACTIVE and UNLIMITED ZRTP endpoints only.
  4. ZRTP Protocol version was changed to 0.90 according to ZRTP Internet Draft.
	More details about these changes can be found in libzrtp.



27  June 2008  (Linux 0.9.217), (MacOS 0.9.235), (Win 0.9.201)
====================================================================================

What's new in ZRTP:

  1.  Small bug was fixed in S0 calculation: when RS1 is corrupted the library uses RS2 instead;
  2. Some changes in Makefile and building process: unused header were eliminated from the installation
process;
  3. DBUILD_WITH_ZRTP_MUTEXES was replaced with --enable_mutexes option passed to                                        
./configure script. This change allows not to specify any libzrtp compilation flags during user application
compilation. --enable-mutexes adds BUILD_ZRTP_MUTEXES definition to the
./config/zrtp_unix_config.h so if you build libzrtp on other platforms - define this flag manually (windows                                                
configuration file already includes this option);
  4. Clean-up in .h and .c comments was made.

What's new:

  1. Reorganized and simplified IPC between daemon and GUI. (TCP server was eliminated) 
(for Unix platforms);
  2. Mac OS Zfone daemon is now managed by lounchd. It is native OS X approach and prevents some
problems when zfoned takes all CPU power. In addition zfoned now automatic ally starts and stops
when Zfone GUI is opened. (For Mac OS X);
  3. Firewall manage on Mac OS X was improved and optimized. Sources is more clear now.(For Mac OS X)
  4. All development process for Mac OS X was moved from Gnu Autotools to Xcode. All ZFone sources
with Xcode projects are available. (For Mac OS X).
  5. All libzrtp and ZFone were examined by Coverity prevent tool. Few resource leaks were found and fixed. 

10  June 2008  (Linux 0.9.211), (MacOS 0.9.216), (Win 0.9.198)
====================================================================================

What's new in ZRTP:

  1. Fixed bug with restoring RS secret from back-when session was interrupted;
  2. Some minor corrections in Zfone preferences panel



04  June 2008  (Linux 0.9.210), (MacOS 0.9.215), (Win 0.9.197)
====================================================================================

What's new in ZRTP:

  1. New names for: other_secret - pbxs; srtps - auxs. In bits and secrets storages;
  2. RS2 secret was eliminated form DH s0 calculation;
  3. Protocol version number was increased to 0.85



21 May 2008  (Linux 0.9.208), (MacOS 0.9.212), (Win 0.9.196)
====================================================================================

What's new in ZRTP:

  1. According to the new version of the Internet Draft Signaling secret was removed from the
protocol and from the sources. It was not used by interface functions and developers need not change
anything in libzrtp based applications.
  2. DH4K Key exchange was eliminated from the specification and from the sources. Now ECDH is used for
all larger AES key sizes.

02 April 2008  (Linux 0.9.205), (MacOS 0.9.210), (Win 0.9.192)
====================================================================================

What's new:

  1. New Secure --> Clear --> Secure scenario was implemented according to the new version of ZRTP
 INow, when you go Clear and go Secure again ZFone will use Multistream mode and eliminate DH
exchange. See ZRTP Internet Draft section 5.7.2.1. for more information.

18 March 2008  (Linux 0.9.201), (MacOS 0.9.208), (Win 0.9.191)
====================================================================================

What's new:

  1. New "Multistream" mode was implemented to extend call with additional streams in secure and fast way,
without DH exchange. This mode is used by default in all versions of Zfone; "Preshared" mode was
also streamlined to use fewer packets. Both of these modes are part of the new ZRTP Internet Draft;
  2. Lots of other cryptographic improvements according to ZRTP Internet Draft version 6;
  3. Zfone now is Windows Vista ready. The same installation package is used for both Vista and XP;
  4. Zfone for Windows 64-bit XP and Vista. Single installer includes separate binaries for 32-bit and 64-bit
versions and it installs the appropriate one according to the type of the OS;
  5. New default configuration file for EC builds: only EC256 is enabled by default;
  6. New "Smart" crypto preferences which helps user to adjust EC options;
  7. Improved installer for EC build which can update non-EC ZFone to EC version and vice-versa;
  8. Labels are now more clear for crypto components in "Preferences panel" and "Connection settings";
  9. Flushes ZRTP cache after every call to prevent data losses on emergency exit or shutting down;
  10. Mark trusted MiTM caches with special prefix in "Caches" window;
  11. Added default names for ZRTP cache entries from SIP URI;
  12. Improved RNG entropy collection uses dropped outgoing media as an entropy source;
  13. Sources clarification (cleared unused and old commands from engine-GUI communications).

Bug Fixes:

  1. Some bugs in Windows version of Zfone were fixed;

01 Feb 2008  (Linux 0.8.184), (MacOS 0.8.184), (Win 0.8.168)
====================================================================================

What's new in ZRTP:

  1.  Elliptic Curve Crypto functions were added to the libzrtp. This option is available for Zfone customers
 and partners only;
  2. ZRTP Client ID was extended to 16bits and as result  protocol version number was increased to 0.82;
  3.  New event zrtp_event_t::ZRTP_EVENT_NO_ZRTP_QUICK was added. It allows user-application to
 make an fast assumption about ZRTP support by the remote peer.

What's new:

  • There is a build with  Elliptic Curve Crypto functions support available for our enterprise customers;
(for all platforms)

Bug Fixes:

  • Critical issue with installation of Zfone for Windows was resolved. We conjecture that Windows have
 some problems with drivers information cache integrity. Corruption if this cache may prevent Zfone
 from being installed successfully. We have added special unite which can help  to fix this issue.  We
hope that, current build will be extremely useful for our Windows users who have problem with Zfone
 upgrade or installation; (for Windows platform)

23 Jan 2008  (Linux 0.8.182), (MacOS 0.8.186), (Win 0.8.157)
====================================================================================

What's new in ZRTP:

  1. Wixed issue with the wrong string name for ErrorACK packet. In result previous version of libzrtp had
 bug with interoperability with ZRTP implementations by other vendors;
  2. Fixed bug with HMAC keys truncation. Current version of the library doesn't truncate the keys;
  3. Fixed bug with ConfirmAck dropping during alert sounds playing. Such issue took place with Zfone for
 Linux, when libzrtp engine drops all outgoing traffic during “Secure” alert. In result it caused extra retry
 of Confirm2/ConfirmACK exchange;
  4. Added one more Hello packet check: all Hello->ZID values must be the same within single session. IF
 libzrtp detect such error it rises error event with code zrtp_protocol_error_t::zrtp_error_wrong_zid.
  5. Fixed algorithm of errors handling: libzrtp doesn't accept ERROR messages in ZRTP_NONE state to
 user application from prevent re-cyclical error event; fixed state-handler function of
 ZRTP_INITIATING_ERROR state.

What's new:

  • RTP detection was improved to work more smoothly with embedded ZRTP endpoints: as a rule,
 embedded ZRTP endpoint start ZRTP exchange before starting the media. Zfone doesn't see incoming
 RTP traffic and can't “link” incoming and outgoing RTP streams to the single call. To avoid this problem
 Zfone looks for incoming Hello messages from non-ZFone endpoints and marks such stream as RTP.;
 (for all platforms)
  • If user doesn't specify name for the endpoint, Zfone store SIP URI to the cache by default. (for all
 platforms)

Bug Fixes:

  • Made several fixes is sources for Symbian compatibility; (for Unix sources brunch)
  • Fixed bug with wrong time-stamp of MiTM secrets in “Caches” window.(for all platforms)
  • Fixed bug with “Duplicated ZID” issue on Windows platform.
    



14 Jan 2008  (Linux 0.8.174), (MacOS 0.8.180), (Win 0.8.149)
====================================================================================

What's
new in ZRTP:


    
	
  1. Some fixes in cache logic: "secure since" was eliminated from library logic and moved to the zfone logic
 as result structure of cache was changed. Developers who don't use internal realization should apply
 necessary changes. (See necessary sections of developers guide and API description for more
 information)
    
	
  2. Improved “cache TTL” logic according to the last version of the Internet Draft.
    
	
  3. New PBX handling logic:  new API and set of events for the enrollment ritual; new SAS relaying logic.
Now handling of  ZRTP call is much easy for PBX and VoIP clients developers. Just one function should
 be call for enrollment and one for SAS transferring. See zrtp_pbx.h and necessary sections of the
 Developers Guide and API descryptiuon for more information. 
    
	
  4. Public key exchange schemes, based on Elliptic Curve were added for enterprise solutions;
    
	
  5. New feature to prevent DOS attacks was added to libzrtp and Zfones. See sec. 9.1 and 10 of ZRTP
 Internet draft and description of  zrtp_set_signaling_hash() and zrtp_get_signaling_hash() functions.
    



What's
new:


    
	
  •  Full support of ZRTP secure call using Asterisk PBX. This option is in beta testing phase and works
 with special pre-configured Asterisk PBXes. For more information please email to Zfone support
 service. (for all platforms);
    
	
  • Protection against DOS attacks to ZRTP protocol was integrated into Zfone (for all platforms).
    
	
  • Zfone sources was re-factored to make them more clear and easy for understanding (for all platforms).
    



Bug
Fixes:


    
	
  • GUI Freezing problem was solved on Linux64 platforms.
    




16 Nov 2007  (Linux 0.7.149), (MacOS 0.7.159), (Win 0.7.134)
====================================================================================

What's new:


    
	
  •  "delete secret" option was added. to windows->secrets menu;
    
	
  •  color marks for secrets: gray- expired, yellow - PBX secret. white - common retain secret.
    
	
  • beta of the new PBX enrolment API is available
    




Bug Fixes:


    
	
  • cache management logic was improved according to ZRTP Internet Draft;
    




09 Nov 2007  (Linux 0.7.144), (MacOS 0.7.154), (Win 0.7.130)
====================================================================================

What's new:


    
	
  • Mac OS X 10.5 Leopard support.  Be careful! Zfone doesn't encrypt all new iChat 4.0 features like 
desktop sharing, files transferring, presentations and etc. We encrypt voice and video only. May be in  
following builds we will support these options.
    
	
  • bnlib was updated to version 1.14
    
	
  • There are some changes in shared secrets indicators. Now we have one row of indicators: gray means 
that secret isn't cached, green – secret is matched with remote one and red – secret was uploaded from 
the cache but doesn't matched with other party's secret.
    



30 Oct 2007  (Linux 0.7.138), (MacOS 0.7.147), (Win 0.7.125)
====================================================================================

Bug Fixes:


    
	
  • Shared secrets flags indicators were redesigned (see Zfone menu “Connection settings”);
    
	
  • ”Stay secure” option were renamed and inverted. Now this option's name is “Allow switching plain RTP”;
    
	
  • Sound warnings about interruption in outgoing media was enabled by default;
    
	
  • Fixed bug wrong build number on PowerPC macs.
    




23 Oct 2007  (Linux 0.7.136), (MacOS 0.7.145), (Win 0.7.123)
====================================================================================

Bug Fixes:


    
	
  • Fixed “Create a bug report” option for non root Mac OS X users;
    
	
  • Some refactoring of bnlib usage.
    



What's
new:


    
	
  1. New Zfone doesn't drop Rtp media on switching to Secure state to prevent some VoIP clients from 
closing the channel. For now this trick is enabled for iChat only.(for Mac OS);
    
	
  2. Zfone skips some amount of media packets after the SIP BYE. It should prevent it from reporting “false 
    
	
  3. alarms” when call is finished but there are some media still in the cloud. (for all platforms);
    
	
  4. Some improvements in iChat calls detection (for Mac OS).
    




15 Oct 2007  (Linux 0.7.133), (MacOS 0.7.141), (Win 0.7.121)
====================================================================================

Bug Fixes:


    
	
  • Fixed bug with "early" calls linking when media starts before SIP; 
symptoms:  Video calls for Counterpath products may look like two separate calls (audio and video);
    
	
  • Fixed set of media codecs supported by Zfone RTP detection heuristics. It should improve problems with 
SJPhone and X-Lite calls detection;
symptoms: Zfone stayed IDLE during some VoIP calls;
    
	
  • Fixed bug with displaying different SASes during Video calls;
    
	
  • Fixed several critical bugs which caused Windows driver crashes;
    
	
  • Fixed bug when Zfone control panel for Windows doesn't work for multiple logins;
    



What's
new:


    
	
  1. Uninstall script for MacOS allows to remove all Zfone related data from your Mac (log files, cache of the 
secrets, configuration profile tec.) (for Mac OS);
    
	
  2. New icons set for Mac OS installer and uninstaller (for Mac OS);
    
	
  3. New icon for verified check-box (for all platforms);
    
	
  4. Warning on interruptions in outgoing media; It should protect users from VoIP client's changing the 
media transport pass by Zfone encryption engine. ZFone alarms user by means of Rx indicator, 
changing the status indicator to “Encryption interrupted”. If the encryption of outgoing media was 
interrupted for a more that 5 seconds – sound alarm will be played (for all platforms);
    



What's
new in ZRTP:


    
	
  1. ZRTP state-machine waits for Hello in NO_ZRTP state;
    
	
  2. Fixed issue with verified flag  disappearances after cache losing;
    



Known
Issues:


    
	
  • iChat video calls sometimes look like two separate calls (audio and video).  zfone GUI gets confused when this happens;
    
	
  • iChat seems to crash sometimes probably related to zfone;
    




25 September 2007  (Linux 0.7.117), (MacOS 0.7.123), (Win 0.7.105)
====================================================================================

Bug Fixes


    
	
  • A few errors and warnings were fixed;
    



What's
new:


    
	
  1. ICE support. Current release Zfone supports VoIP clients using ICE protocol for NAT traversing;  
For our tests VoIP clients by Counterpath eg: EyeBeam and Bria were used. We will test more VoIP
clients later;
info: We have discovered that Counterpath clients may establish asymmetric RTP channels on LAN 
calls. When incoming traffic goes through LAN channel but outgoing – through media relay. Zfone fails 
to detect such calls – we will fix this soon (for all platforms);
    
	
  2. Linking with “early” SIP sessions; when media starts right after the first SIP INVITE. As result: faster and 
more effective calls detection. (for all platforms);
    
	
  3. On Mac OS and Linux html ChangeLog file is a part of the package and on 
Windows it's available for reviewing after the installation (for all platforms);
    
	
  4. New "verified" style: padlock icon and menu item (for all platforms);
    
	
  5. Some changes for better compatibility with Asterisk PBX according to the latest changes in ZRTP 
internet draft.
    




11 Sep 2007  (Linux 0.7.112), (MacOS 0.7.118), (Win 0.7.102)
====================================================================================

Bug Fixes


    
	
  • Windows MTU 1400 fixed (SIP was too big);
symptoms: May not detect SIP sessions and as result link calls by "time window";
    
	
  • Count of active audio calls was fixed;
symptoms: "Smart closing" of non confirmed calls may not work;
    



What's
new:


    
	
  1. "Clear SIP sessions" options was added. It allows removal of unused and unconfirmed SIP sessions and 
keeps the list of active calls clean. "Unconfirmed" - session with incomplete SIP negotiation, ACK is 
missing. "Unused" - unclosed SIP session without a BYE packet (for all platforms);
    
	
  2. RC script was added to the Linux package. It allows running zfoned on system startup. After installation 
it will be copied to the /etc/inid.d folder  (for Linux ZFone only);
    
	
  3. ZFone installation script makes zfone application entry at your KDE or Gnome desktop manager. (look 
for ZFone at "Internet" section at your Applications panel) (for Linux ZFone only);
    
	
  4. “Reset IP filter" was optimized to work with the new heuristics engine (for all platforms).
    



Reorganization:


    
	
  • Heuristics engine sources were split to zfone_heurist.c and zfone_heurist_utils.c. The first one contains 
kernel logic and the second one tests and utils.
